sub_title: Founder, Reconsidered | Sustainable Business + Corporate Responsibility Strategy and Communications
summary:
Hi, I'm Jess üëã. I'm here to help impact leaders drive bigger, bolder, more sustainable change. Through my company Reconsidered, I create content, teach courses and consult on sustainable business strategy and communications for leading brands and organizations ‚Äî all toward a vision of a more thriving, just and resilient world.

Since launching Reconsidered in 2017, I've had the privilege to support a range of future-focused clients including Etsy, EILEEN FISHER, Mailchimp, Sir Kensington's (Unilever), C&A, Tommy Hilfiger (PVH), BESTSELLER, JACK & JONES, J.Crew, Fashion for Good, Textile Exchange, Alliance for Water Stewardship and the UN Development Programme. My experience is centered in ESG strategy, communications, marketing, stakeholder engagement and impact measurement, with a particular focus on corporate social responsibility, environmental sustainability and social justice.

Prior to Reconsidered, I approached the impact space from a number of different perspectives ‚Äî as a journalist, as an entrepreneur, as an academic and in-house at a Fortune 500 company.¬†I spent several years leading ESG communications and stakeholder engagement at PVH Corp. and worked on sustainability initiatives with EILEEN FISHER, West Elm and the NYU Stern Center for Business & Human Rights. I also founded a social enterprise selling artisan goods made in Cambodia; led Content and Community at Quirky, an open innovation platform for invention ideas; and worked as a freelance travel writer across 60+ countries. I draw inspiration and motivation from my Chamoru (Native Pacific Islander) and Italian roots; my upbringing in Guam, San Francisco and Rome; and my toddler son's magical view of the world. 

Through Reconsidered, I get to:

üíå Curate a bi-weekly newsletter of fresh finds from the world of sustainable business that goes out to thousands of impact leaders every other week: http://reconsidered.co/sign-up

üë©üèª‚Äçüè´ Teach courses that aim to help impact leaders be the most effective agents of change they can be: https://www.reconsidered.co/courses

üíº Share jobs and career resources to support the next generation of impact leaders: https://www.reconsidered.co/jobs

üëØ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Host a free private community of impact professionals that's been named one of LinkedIn's most engaged groups: https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13847179

I invite you to learn more about our work and DM me if you see an opportunity to partner!

The store‚Äôs debut Cambodia Collection featured a handpicked selection of items that were ethically made, sustainably produced, and collaboratively developed in Cambodia.', 'title': 'Founder', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Self-Employed', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'Self-Employed', 'description': 'Worked as a freelance journalist, content strategist and digital media consultant while living in New York, Rome, Paris, Buenos Aires, Phnom Penh and Guam.

Consulting projects include working with New York's Textile Arts Center to develop a comprehensive retail strategy involving product collaborations with local textile artists, a revamped e-commerce website, and new merchandising for the center's West Village retail location; curating an Ethical Fashion Showcase for Cambodia's first-ever Fashion Week in Phnom Penh, featuring products and stories from local social enterprises and non-profits; and providing strategic advisory services for companies like Ahkun, a marketplace for fair trade products; Greenstart, a cleantech start-up accelerator; Green Breakfast Club, a monthly networking events for eco-entrepreneurs; The Supply Change, a consultancy that connects big brands with fair trade artisans; and Holstee, a sustainable design firm producing art that encourages mindful living.', 'title': 'Freelance Journalist & Content Strategist', 'employment_type': None}]}]
